alert.note: Alert for Dallas; Madison (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 23 at 6:20PM CDT until April 23 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR POLK...SOUTHWESTERN STORY...NORTHEASTERN MADISON...SOUTHEASTERN BOONE...EASTERN DALLAS AND NORTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTIES... At 620 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Woodward to Grimes to near West Des Moines, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Des Moines, Ames, West Des Moines, Ankeny, Urbandale, Johnston, Clive, Altoona, Waukee, Boone, Norwalk, Pleasant Hill, Grimes, Windsor Heights, Bondurant, Polk City, Huxley, Saylorville, Madrid and Slater. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
